titleStmt.title: Certaine easie and profitable points in husbandrie for the improving and making of ground fertile, for the increasing and preserving of tymber, and for the gathering in of corne, in late and wet harvests.
titleStmt.author: Shaw, John, writer on agriculture.

titleStmt.title: Certaine easie and profitable points in husbandrie for the improving and making of ground fertile, for the increasing and preserving of tymber, and for the gathering in of corne, in late and wet harvests.
titleStmt.author: Shaw, John, writer on agriculture.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Barnard Alsop, and are to bee sold at the signe of the thr[ee?] flower deluces, in Fleet-street, over against Saint Brides lane end,

notesStmt.note: Attributed to Shaw by STC (2nd ed.) and NUC pre-1956 imprints.
Imperfect: t.p. has small hole with slight loss of print.
Reproduction of original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
